messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 26.0 years old, female, of Black or African American descent. You have college graduate and an annual income of $20,000 - $34,999. English is your first language. You are 5 feet 0 inches tall and weighs 184 pounds.You find it moderately important to live in the best possible health. You believe that eating right, exercising, and taking preventive measures will keep you healthy for life. You think your health depends on how well you take care of yourself. You sometimes try to prevent disease and illness, but it's not a priority. You make some efforts to stay healthy, but you don't do everything possible. You are someone who You strongly agree that you are extraverted and enthusiastic. You unknown that you are agreeable and kind. You strongly agree that you are dependable and organized. You strongly agree that you are emotionally stable and calm. You unknown that you are open to experience and imaginative.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think they are more concerned about what is easier for them rather than for you. In my experience they would much rather just give you something than figuring out why you are feeling this way or have the problems you have
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
When I'm extreme sick I'm just anxious about what they are going to say. Usually at my doctor/hospital they have a set diagnosis for everything you come in with
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

A friend when to the ER for a certain thing, the doctors told her it was something serious but what they told her it was needed to be tested to find that out so I told her she needed to go somewhere else cause that needed to be tested

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 28.0 years old, female, of White descent. In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

It's not necessarily that I don't trust my doctor but  I think she's far too rushed for such a serious matter. She is very casual and nonchalant about things that are of great importance to my life. She brushes off side effects/symptoms as if they are normal every day things but then puts me on medication to alter them and brings up having to have heart surgery. I am getting mixed messages and it makes me unsure of the severity or what she is thinking about course of treatment.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The unknown of what the results of a procedure will be.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
None of these questions, that's for sure. My knowledge of medical issues was frequently demonstrated while answering questions from clients and completing their medical claims

He has many years of experience, is honest and he finds out what's wrong so I don't have to keep coming back
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The only concern I have when I go for a visit is wondering if I am going to have a shot or need to draw blood because I hate needles
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was with a family member who was hospitalized and the nurse dropped off some forms to be signed. I understood better what the medical terms meant regarding pain medication so I was able to explain what it meant.

He doesn't always look into what is wrong with me.  He just assumes. I'll tell him what it wrong with me and he will say oh well it sounds like this and that but doesn't do any kid of tests at all. Thats not OK to hold someone's life in their hands
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Because I feel like he doesn't really care if there is anything wrong with me he's just there to make money
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I have had a lot of negative experiences based on that. But I am trying to eat healthier to be healthier

I trust my primary physician because I take the time to ask them questions and gauge their answer.  If they do not seem to speak as if they have my needs in their consideration, I switch physicians.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I usually have to go to the doctor for sick visits.  In that frame of mind, I am already uncomfortable.  I am usually worried that I will have a long way to recovery, or I will need to take expensive medication.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My father is a dentist and my mother is an RN.  I was taught to read labels, ask questions and get concrete evidence when evaluating medical decisions.

Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
My blood pressure always goes up at doctors.  Know will have to wait for results.  Sometimes doctor acts like his time is more important than you
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Helped my mother with her cancer.  Learned a lot about lymphoma and leukemia.  Also about chemotherapy and blood tests of red and white blood cells.

Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I just worry sometimes that they might find something that I already didn't know about.  I don't like to be surprised usually.  Especially when it comes to my own body and health.

When I scraped up my leg real bad.  I relied on my knowledge to first clean out the wound and then be able to treat it with medicine and bandage it up until it fully healed again.

what makes me feel most anxious and worried is just the fact that I never know what's to come, I don't my self in situations to have to worry and be anxious at the doctors office but sometimes your body can be going through stuff and you just don't know because if=t is something that only a doctor can tell you is going on. that's about it.

I just don't like doctors offices or hospitals in general.  I have never had any health issues so I am not afraid something is wrong with me.  I just have never liked them.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I have never had a serious health issue, so I do not have an answer for this question.  In general I exercise and eat well and have been healthy so far.

But its always great to hear the physician out because that its there job to do so. They are there to help the public and anyone in need.

Number one, I don't like going to the doctor. I never have liked going to the doctor. I usually go because I have to go. Then, I expect to receive bad news.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

After 58 years, I just know my own body. Couple my personal knowledge with biology and some health magazines, I just figured out some problems. I felt like my throat was closing up and something was in my chest. I di have acid reflux and a hernia in my esophagus.

She shows real interest, offers advice, and listens. She does not lecture but works with me as a teammate to take care of my health.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

That the doctor will detect something that could be life threatening at the least. Even if it not life threatening if I was told that I would have to radically alter my life style such as activities or diet I would find it as a great disruption. At least at first.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I first made my initial visit to my doctor I came prepared with several questions. I was pleased that she did not just talk about what medicines I may have to take but asked about my diet and exercise routine. She was rather pleased that I already had an established exercise program and watched the intake of sodium in my diet and encouraged me to continue on the path I was on.

I don't like the idea of taking medical tests. I always expect the worst and always thing that my blood work or other related tests will come back bad or that I will be diagnosed with something really bad. I also do not like the very sterile and fluorescent lit environment that Dr offices are in.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

So the surgery went incredibly well with only one nurse having poor bedside manner. The issue was the follow-up procedures. Radiation was all set up and ready to go before a sudden visit to the oncologist was scheduled. And we were informed that we were a month behind schedule. After that, suddenly radiation had to be pushed back over two months so four sessions of chemo could be forced through. We don't go to the first surgeon/general practitioner anymore. Apparently that's common with most surgeons: once they're done with you, you yourself don't need help anymore, even if you clearly do.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Money. I have no insurance so if there's something serious and I have to be rushed to the hospital, I will never be able to pay for it. I would rather they just leave me on the examination table to die than help at that point. I'm already in debt because of college loans; I literally can't afford to be in any more debt than I already am.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My mother was recently treated for breast cancer and just had her third of four chemotherapy sessions. She was initially told that she would not need chemo at all and would just have to do radiation to lower the rate of recurrence after the tumor and a lymph node was removed, and then a month later she had to very quickly reschedule, messing up work and therefore putting her insurance at risk. All of the complaints I've given you so far are incredibly fresh in my mind.
